Our last question for today: are there any easy solutions to ironing out these issues?

@NewCities As with any difficult problem, there is no single, easy solution. The low-income housing tax credit (LIHTC) has been the most direct & effective means for creating more affordable multifamily housing, & we anticipate it will continue to be an important component of the solution.

RT @NewCities: #citiforcities @Citi 
Our next question: is the lack of affordable housing primarily an urban issue, or does it impact the s‚Ä¶
@NewCities (2/2) Individuals aged 65+ have been and continue to be the most burdened segment of the population, and those individuals tend to live outside urban centers. #CitiforCities

@NewCities (1/2) While the issue is most acute in high cost areas which tend to be urban, the issue of housing affordability is a national one that touches both the cities and suburbs & even rural communities. #CitiforCities

RT @NewCities: #CitiforCities @Citi 
Thanks for joining us Jeremy. Our 1st question today: what is driving the housing affordability crisis?

@NewCities Demand for rental housing exceeds supply & households that rent are renting for longer before entering homeownership. These factors have contributed to a sharp increase in rents. Rents have outpaced incomes, causing individuals & families to become rent-burdened. #CitiforCities
